name: Lone Tree Golf Club & Hotel

reviews.text: Our son and daughter-in-law held their wedding reception at Lone Tree so we booked a room there. What a great experience. The staff was very accommodating...desk clerk, grill staff, room attendants, manager, event coordinator. The grill closed early on Super Bowl Sunday (although they would have stayed open if we wanted), but they let us hold our own Super Bowl 'Party' there anyway. Rooms were clean. We plan to stay whenever we return to visit our kids.
reviews.title: What a great find!!
This is a great venue for a family gathering.
reviews.text: My niece had her wedding for 130 guests at Lone Tree on 10/16/11 and the day was wonderful. There are (only) 15 hotel rooms. This meant that our immediate/extended family basically had the whole hotel to ourselves over that weekend. On Friday night, they kept the grill open for us. The food was very good and everyone was pleased.This is not an elegant hotel: there is no room service or bellmen and the pool is down the street at a recreation center; however, the rooms are lovely and VERY affordable (bi-level, and several have decks that overlook the golf course.) Our family was impressed and the size made it perfect for us to catch up with each other in a lovely setting.
I have been staying at this wonderful hotel for nearly 20 years now and, unless I have to, due to pre-arrangements, I won't stay anywhere else if i am traveling to Denver or Colorado Springs.
reviews.title: If it's Denver - it's the Lone Tree Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is inexpensive yet many levels above much higher priced hotels in comfort, service, location, and recreation. The rooms all have balconies and the ones that overlook the golf course are fabulous. You can see the mountains and all the way to downtown. Splendid views! The hotel is located directly on and affiliated with a beautiful Arnold Palmer designed golf course with a terrific driving range, a well stocked pro shop with friendly and knowledgeable staff and instructors. The hotel staff are great (especially Diane) and the food is terrific in the restaurant located directly behind the pro shop. I do a great deal of business travel and i have directed many associates to the Lone Tree. We all agree, the Lone Tree is Denver's best kept secret for lodging!
reviews.title: Small wonderful hotel with lodge feel

reviews.text: The food was well prepared, well priced, and the staff was outstanding. We were there for a wedding that was held at the hotel. The staff was polite and very acommadating. If you are thinking of having a wedding in this area, this is the place to check!!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: I've had the pleasure of staying here for more than 5 years. The rooms are extremely large and spacious, not to metion clean. Some of the rooms offer a beautiful view of the golf course. Since there are a limited number of rooms, it is very quiet and almost has a lodge atmosphere about it. The staff is very friendly and bend over backwards to accomodate you. A great perk is the free bucket of range balls to help you relax after a long day. This is also a great place for a small business meeting or retreat.
reviews.title: A great getaway for the business traveler

reviews.text: While planning a family trip to Colorado and Wyoming, we could not find a room in our usual hotel chains. My husband found this and both of us were surprised that Lone Tree had a hotel at the golf course. (We lived in Denver for quite a few years and have played the course many times). We decided to give it a try.
reviews.title: Nice Find and great deal!

reviews.text: The room was large and comfortable. Our room overlooked the #1 Tee box and had a large deck. The furniture was a little dated, but we were only in there to sleep so we were fine with that. Our rate included unlimited range balls and rentals. We brought our clubs so we changed our plan to the "Stay and Play" package. With that, we received two rounds of golf per day. Based on the rates, we were getting a buy one, get one free.
reviews.title: Not a golfer, but a nice room.

reviews.text: The hotel is extremely quiet and the restaurant / bar close early.
reviews.title: Great lodge feel.

reviews.text: The Staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Better than a hotel

reviews.text: I was in Denver for work and originally had reservations at another hotel in the DTC, but got bumped due to an overbooking. The original hotel sent me to the Lone Tree Golf Club and Hotel. I was initially quite skeptical about this hotel - it is very much out of the way, tucked back in a residential neighborhood, and when I arrived, the place was very quiet, almost deserted. From the outside, it didn't appear to be open when I arrived (7pm or so in the evening). The hotel turned out to be great though.
reviews.title: Nice place in a residential neighborhood

reviews.text: There are only a few rooms (15, I believe), and the hotel wasn't even close to full, so it was very quiet - hardly anyone around at all. It is a fairly large facility with conference and meeting spaces, large common room with a fireplace, a restaurant, pro-shop, etc. The hotel looks and feels very much like a mountain lodge. During the day there is a lot more going on since it is a golf club - in the early mornings and the evenings when I was there, it was extremely quiet. The course is right out the back and some of the rooms have views of the course.
reviews.title: Worth more than we paid!

reviews.text: When I arrived, man at the check in desk was very welcoming and friendly, which was esspecially nice after being bumped from another hotel. Overall, the people here were very nice.
reviews.title: It looks like it would be the rooms – but it is the people!

reviews.text: My room was great - spacious, spotlessly clean, nice sitting area, good desk space for working, large and very comfortable bed, and even a nice-sized deck. The decor was a bit dated, but everything was well cared for and comfortable.
reviews.title: Return to Lone Tree

reviews.text: Breakfast is included in the rate and consists of coffee and juice, cereal, bagels, and fruit. It is simple, but good quality.
reviews.title: Back from Afghanistan

reviews.text: Friendly, helpful staff at check-in and check-out. Nice, very adequate breakfast items. Room was very clean and spacious. I would definitely stay here again. The rooms on the golf course have a balcony so it was nice to sit with a cup of coffee and watch the golfers in the quiet morning.
reviews.title: Lovely, quiet, relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saw this on a website for a Denver deal and the golf course attached attracted us. What a delight ! There is only 15 rooms, very clean, service was excellent and it was a great location to Park Meadows Mall and many restaurants. We will definitely go there again when we make the trip into the city.
reviews.title: What a Wonderful Find !!

description: The business traveler or vacationing golfer will discover true comfort while staying in one of our spacious guest suites. All guest rooms have vaulted ceilings and include a wet bar, microwave and refrigerator. Most guest rooms have large balconies with gorgeous golf course views. Hotel guests receive complimentary continental breakfast, wireless internet and a fitness center pass.
